sub_title: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office
summary:
Expertise and Qualifications

Design and Characterization of:
- Semiconductor Lasers (DFB, MicroRing, VCSEL)
- Filters and Sensors
- Transducers 
- Receivers
- Optical Communication Systems
- Optofluidic Lenses
- 3D CAD design
- High Speed RF (waveguides)

Design and Simulation 
- Silicon Photonics
- III-V waveguides (active and passive integration)
- Complex Photonic Structures (Crystals, Metamaterials etc)
- Photonic Integrated Circuits

Expert in Simulation Tools
- Rsoft
- Comsol (Femlab)
- Optiwave
- Matlab
- Zemax
- Mask Layouts


Programming and Automation
- Numerical Modelling 
- Matlab
- ANSI C/C++
- Labview (including automation using GPIB)
- Origin

Optical characterization of optical fibers under ISO-9001 certificate: length, attenuation, chromatic dispersion and polarization mode dispersion
Microwave characterization of optical, electrical and of all-optical and electro-optic devices

Activities in writing research project proposals and seeking for grant funding from National and EU research funding resources

Specialties: Photonic Design, Photonics engineering, Applied physics, Optoelectronics, Optical communications, Fiber engineering, Sensing engineering, Algorithmic Design, Problem Solving, Data analysis, Complexity analysis

projects.title: CONECT – ARISTEIA II
projects.description: Research associate and in charge of experimental setup and characterization on optically coupled networks covering different aspects, from sensing to communications and cryptography. Main focus is to experimentally demonstrate for the first time the potential of laser networks to exploit intrinsic physical properties - including complex dynamics and synchronization - in order to support crucial applications within a network.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

projects.title: CLARITY
projects.description:
CLARITY is a 3-years research project funded under the seventh framework programme (FP7) in the research area: ICT-2011.3.5 Core and disruptive photonic technologies. The project envisions the development and demonstration of a set of technologies which will radically change the current scenery of mid Infrared photonic systems in terms of performance, size and cost. The technology vehicles are ultra-low noise quantum cascade laser sources and ultra-wideband frequency converters based on silicon nano-waveguides and microstructured soft-glass fibers.
Role in the project:
Chief design and simulations expert. Responsible for the design of silicon waveguides to serve as sensing elements in mid-IR and also to design special waveguide structures for parametric non-linear conversion from mid-IR to near-IR. Also responsible for the design of the full photonic integrated chip and mask layout delivery to the foundry

projects.title: EEONPO
projects.description:
Modeling of Network Energy Aspects
In the framework of the program entitled “Energy efficient optical network planning and operation”, I was assigned to simulate optical networks with respect to their energy consumption efficiency.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

projects.title: FAST-DOT
projects.description:
COMPACT ULTRAFAST LASER SOURCES BASED ON NOVEL QUANTUM DOT STRUCTURES
The vision of FAST-DOT is to revolutionise the use of lasers in the biomedical field providing both practitioners and researchers with pocket sized ultra high performance lasers at a substantially lower cost making their widespread use affordable.
Role in the project:
Design, Modeling and Characterization of Quantum-Dot based Semiconductor Optical Amplifiers
Successfully delivered innovative design for new type of tapered SOAs. Achieved optimum beam quality and high gain for sub-picosecond pulsed signals for the best possible coupling with an optical fiber. Experimentally characterized associated devices fabricated within the project.
Selected Achievements
•	Record 42W peak power in MOPA configuration with the proposed SOA design
•	Optimally reduced M2 of the SOA designed with 3dB increased coupling efficiency in optical fiber

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

projects.title: PHASORS
projects.description:
Simulation and Characterization of Parametric Optical Conversion
Investigated the properties of parametric amplifiers via simulation of their performance using own-developed software. Also characterized two section coupled cavity DFB lasers fabricated during the project.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

projects.title: BONE
projects.description:
The core activity of the BONE-project is the stimulation of intensified collaboration, exchange of researchers and integration of activities and know-how into and amongst partners. Through the establishment of Virtual Centres of Excellence, the BONE-project looks into the future and builds and supports the final “Network of the Future” through education & training, research tools & testlabs on new technologies & architectures. The leading-edge position of European Research in the field and, consequently, of European industry, could be threatened by returning to an uncoordinated and scattered approach to optical networking research. BONE consolidates the process, supported during FP6, of integration and reorganization of research efforts across European academic and industrial groups in FP7 through:

    Building Virtual Centres of Excellence that cover specific issues in the field of Optical Networking that can serve to European industry with education & training, research tools & testlabs and pave the way to development of new technologies & architectures.
    Reaching out, including and linking to research activities in national programmes, or programmes outside Europe.
    Stimulating an intensified collaboration, exchange of researchers between the research groups involved and active in the field.
    Disseminating the expertise and know-how of these European Research groups to a broader audience, both R&D oriented as well as industry- and decision maker oriented.
Role in the project:
Design and Simulation Specialist
Involved in the design and simulation of novel micro-ring photonic components in order to enhance the feasibility of all-optical networks.

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office

projects.title: PICASSO
projects.description:
The ultimate goal of PICASSO is the development of photonic components and subsystems to build chaos-based optical communication systems. Monolithic and hybrid photonic integrated circuits will be designed and developed for the realization of chaotic transmitters and receivers. Extensive security testing, verification and calibration of the chaos encoded communication system will be performed. Different types of transmitter/receiver pairs will be fabricated and the validity of the security assumptions will be proved experimentally. Fully functional transmitter and receiver modules will be developed at four adjacent wavelengths of the ITU grid (100 GHz spacing) in the C band of the telecommunications window operating at 2.4 and 10 Gb/s. Compatibility with the existing infrastructure will be exhaustively tested and possible interactions between chaos encoded channels and conventional neighboring channels will be investigated. 
Role in the project:
Waveguiding Simulation Specialist
Investigated the possibilities of using air-gaps in monolithically integrated chaotic laser sources to be used in chaotic encryption communication systems

contributors.headline: Patent Examiner at European Patent Office
Associate Professor - Universitat de les Illes Balears & IFISC. M.I.T. TR35 Award winner.

projects.title: WAPITI
projects.description:
WAPITI's vision is the development/realization settlement of a novel technology and its implementation in a new mesoscopic device generation that will enable crucial miniaturization and cost reduction. WAPITI has identified wafer-bonding as the ideal/appropriate technology for the realisation of optical microcircuits integrating passive photonic / active optoelectronical and active photonic driven building blocks for novel functionalities and microsystems.

WAPITI demonstrated the potential and versatility of the technology in microring resonator building blocks in InGaAsP/InP bonded on GaAs wafers by realising ultra compact devices for MAN data rates.
Role in the project:
Chief design and modeling expert. Responsible for design and simulation of active microring laser sources integrated with passive waveguides using waferbonding techniques. Successfully delivered specifications to manufacturers. Experimentally characterized fabricated devices and incorporated them in optical communication systems. 
Selected Achievements
•	Full Rate Equations Modeling of Microring Lasers
•	Directly modulated microring laser source at 7Gb/s (World record, at the time). 
•	Successful transmission of 2.4Gb/s signal through 50km of optical fiber from a microring laser source. 
•	Broadly tunable (40nm) laser source based on double microring integrated coupled sources.
•	Tunable wavelength conversion at telecom wavelengths.

profile_positions.description:
Eulambia Advanced Technologies Ltd. is a startup of the University of Athens and I have been in charge of the photonics part of the company since its foundation in 2013. The company’s clients include Schlumberger, the world's largest oilfield services company, providing them with RnD services and prototypes in photonics and electronics.
My main duties involve the design and fabrication of photonic prototypes for application specific solutions of the industry and academia.

- Integrated Photonics and Optical Networks (NKUA-NTUA - postgraduate)
- Computer Networks and Security (NKUA-Military School for Telecommunication Officers - postgraduate)

- Supervised 5 undergraduate and postgraduate students, 1 Ph. D thesis on Optical Networks
- Managed and was technical supervisor as research Engineer for 10 FP6-FP7 EU Research Projects: in the fields of next generation optical Networks, Data analysis and Chemometrics-Statistics, Photonic Artificial Intelligence Systems. Technical Involvement in those projects is the following:
